casebody.data:
Berger et al., Appellants and Cross-Appellees, v. City of Port Clinton, Appellee and Cross-Appellant.

[Cite as Berger v. Port Clinton (1994), 71 Ohio St.3d 1213.]

(No. 93-1399 Submitted October 12, 1994 Decided December 27, 1994.) Spitler & Williams-Young Co., L.P.A., Steven M. Spitler, Marc G. Williams-Young and Debra M. Jennings, ■ for appellants and cross-appellees. Flynn, Py & Kruse, L.P.A., and John A. Coppeler, for appellee and cross-appellant.

This cause is dismissed, sua sponte, as having been improvidently allowed.

A.W. Sweeney, Douglas, Wright, Resnick, F.E. Sweeney and Pfeifer, JJ., concur. Moyer, C.J., dissents. Moyer, C.J.,

dissenting. I dissent. I would affirm the well-reasoned decision of the court of appeals.
